clinical_study.brief_title: A Home Visit Program and Perceived Care Burden
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of a Home Visit Program for Caregivers of Asthmatic Patients on Perceived Care Burden

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to determine the effect of a home visit program provided to the caregivers of asthmatic patients on the perceived care burden. A randomized controlled trial was used. The sample consisted of 30 participants in the intervention group and 30 participants in the control group. A home visit program including education and counseling was applied to participants in the intervention group.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study was to determine the effect of a home visit program provided to the caregivers of asthmatic patients on the perceived care burden. A randomized controlled trial was used. The sample consisted of 30 participants in the intervention group and 30 participants in the control group. A home visit program including education and counseling was applied to participants in the intervention group. A total of five home visits over three months were performed. Data were collected by a personal information form, and the Zarit Caregiver Burden Scale (ZCBS).

primary_outcome.description: The scale consists of 18 questions. The minimum test score is 0 and the maximum score is 72. Care burden increases as the score from the scale increases.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- giving care to a patient who was poorly controlled or uncontrolled asthma
- giving care to a patient who used an inhaler
- age 18 or over
- volunteering to participate to the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- having a disease with a neuro-psychiatric diagnosis
- having vision and hearing problems
